page.title: 16HOME LIFE 2 - OWERSBY
page.content: The farmers wife of 1985 plays quite a different role from that of her pre- decessor in many ways.She no longer has to be up at dawn black-leading the grate or lighting the copper fire on wash days,but has all the modern electrical equipment as a town house- wife.She must be prepared at times to stop whatever she's doing when help is needed on the farm,acting also as sec- retary and errand girl.She uses the family car for her weekly trips to the supermarket.Bread costs 40-50p.Butter is 50p per 250g and sugar 46p for 1kg. She spends much time alone.Her husband hasn't a 9 to 5 job,but in summer and particularly at harvest time he works 12-14 hours a day,weekends too.In spite of this,it is by far healthier living in the country,away from the fumes and pollution of the towns and cities.
